chunk: That reference is then replaced with the contents of the Chunk.
resource.isfolder: Labeled as 'Container', this specifies whether or not the Resource renders with a / in Friendly URLs instead of its suffix.
resource.longtitle: A longer title of the Resource.
resource.description: An extended description of the Resource.
resource.alias: The URL alias to use, if your site is using Friendly URLs. A Resource with alias 'home' and Content Type 'html' would render 'home.html' if it isn't a Container.
resource.published: If the Resource is Published, or viewable on the front-end.
resource.introtext: Also called 'Summary', an introductory excerpt of the Resource's content. Useful for blogs or searching.
resource.content: The actual content of the Resource.
resource.template: A reference to the [Template](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/building-sites/elements/templates) that this Resource is using.
resource.menutitle: The title to show for the Resource when displayed in a menu.
resource.hidemenu: Also called 'Hide from Menus', if set, this Resource will not show in most Menu or Navigation snippets.
resource.menuindex: The order index of the Resource in a menu. Higher order means later.
resource.createdby: The ID of the user who created the Resource.
resource.editedby: The ID of the last user to edit the Resource.
resource.deleted: If the Resource is deleted or not.
resource.deletedby: The ID of the user who deleted the Resource.
resource.publishedby: The ID of the user who last published the Resource.
resource.createdon: The date the Resource was created.
resource.publishedon: The date the Resource was published.
resource.editedon: The date the Resource was last edited.
resource.deletedon: The date the Resource was deleted.
modx.modifier.if: `if` - sets an additional condition. `input` - adds the data to be processed to the tag.
modx.modifier.or: Can be used to string output modifiers together with an "OR" relationship.
modx.modifier.and: Can be used to string output modifiers together with an "AND" relationship.
modx.modifier.isequalto: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it's the same. Used with "then" and "else".
modx.modifier.notequalto: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it is not the same. Used with "then" and "else".
modx.modifier.greaterthanorequalto: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it is greater than or equal to the value. Used with "then" and "else".
modx.modifier.isgreaterthan: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it is greater than the value. Used with "then" and "else".
modx.modifier.equaltoorlessthan: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it is less then or equal to the value. Used with "then" and "else".
modx.modifier.islowerthan: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it is less than the value. Used with "then" and "else".
modx.modifier.contains: Checks to see if value contains a passed string.
modx.modifier.containsnot: Check to see if the value does not contain the passed string.
modx.modifier.in: Check to see if the value is in an array (comma seperated).
modx.modifier.hide: Will check earlier conditions, and hide the element if the conditions were met.
modx.modifier.show: Will check earlier conditions, and show the element if the conditions were met.
modx.modifier.select: Output a replacement, if the value is found in the list of values before the equal sign. Otherwise the result is empty.
modx.modifier.memberof: Checks if the user is a member of the specified group(s).
modx.modifier.cat: Appends the option's value (if not empty) to the input value.
modx.modifier.after: Appends the options value to the input value (if both not empty) Added in 2.6.0.
modx.modifier.before: Prepends the options value to the input value (if both not empty) Added in 2.6.0.
modx.modifier.lcase: Transforms strings to lowercase. Similar to PHP's [strtolower](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.strtolower.php).
modx.modifier.ucase: Transforms strings to uppercase. Similar to PHP's [strtoupper](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.strtoupper.php).
modx.modifier.ucwords: Transforms the first letter of a word to uppercase. Similar to PHP's [ucwords](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.ucwords.php).
modx.modifier.ucfirst: Transforms the first letter of the string to uppercase. Similar to PHP's [ucfirst](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.ucfirst.php).
modx.modifier.htmlent: Replaces any character that has an HTML entity with that entity. Similar to PHP's [htmlentities](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.htmlentities.php). Uses the current value the system setting `modx_charset` with flag `ENT_QUOTES`.
modx.modifier.esc: Safely escapes character values using regex and str_replace.
modx.modifier.strip: Replaces all linebreaks, tabs and multiple spaces with just one space.
modx.modifier.striptags: Removes HTML tags from the input. Optionally accepts a value to indicate which tags to allow. Similar to PHP's [strip_tags](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.strip-tags.php).
modx.modifier.stripmodxtags: Removes MODX tags from the input. (Added in v2.7).
modx.modifier.len: Counts the length of the passed string. Similar to PHP's [strlen](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.strlen.php).
modx.modifier.reverse: Reverses the input, character by character. Similar to PHP's [strrev](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.strrev.php).
modx.modifier.wordwrap: Inserts a newline character after the set amount of characters. Similar to PHP's [wordwrap](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.wordwrap.php). Takes optional value to set wordwrap position.
modx.modifier.wordwrapcut: Inserts a newline character after the set amount of characters, irrespective of word boundaries. Similar to PHP's [wordwrap](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.wordwrap.php), with word cutting enabled. Takes optional value to set wordwrap position.
modx.modifier.limit: Limits a string to a certain number of characters. Defaults to `100`.
modx.modifier.ellipsis: Adds an ellipsis to and truncates a string if it's longer than a certain number of characters. Only uses spaces as breakpoints. Defaults to `100`.
modx.modifier.tag: Displays the raw element without the :tag. Useful for documentation.
modx.modifier.tvLabel: Display's the Label from a tv usefull when using select or checkboxes etc where you use `Label==1`.
modx.modifier.divide: Returns input divided by option (default: /2) Does not accept 0.
modx.modifier.modulus: Returns the option modulus on input (default: %2, returns 0 or 1).
modx.modifier.ifempty: Returns the input value if empty.
modx.modifier.notempty: Returns the input value if not empty.
modx.modifier.nl2br:
Converts a new line character (
) to an html element. Use this if you're taking in input, you think that there should be new lines in it, and there aren't. Similar to PHP's [nl2br](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.nl2br.php).
modx.modifier.date: Formats a unix timestamp into a different format. Similar to PHP's [strftime](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.strftime.php). Value is format. See [Date Formats](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/building-sites/tag-syntax/date-formats).
modx.modifier.strtotime: Converts a date string into a unix timestamp. Useful to combine this with the date output filter. Similar to PHP's [strtotime](http://www.php.net/strtotime). Takes in a date. See [Date Formats](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/building-sites/tag-syntax/date-formats).
modx.modifier.fuzzydate: Returns a pretty date format with yesterday and today being filtered. Takes in a date.
modx.modifier.ago: Returns a pretty date format in seconds, minutes, weeks or months ago. Takes in a date (strtotime).
modx.modifier.md5: Creates an MD5 hash of the input string. Similar to PHP's [md5](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.md5.php).
modx.modifier.cdata: Wraps the text with CDATA tags.
modx.modifier.userinfo: Returns the requested user data. The element must be a modUser ID. The value field is the column to grab, e.g. fullname, email.
modx.modifier.isloggedin: Returns true if user is authenticated in this context.
modx.modifier.isnotloggedin: Returns true if user is not authenticated in this context.
modx.modifier.toPlaceholder: Puts the input value into the passed placeholder. Does not prevent the output of the TV value, so add ```[[*someTV:toPlaceholder=`placeholder`:notempty=``]]``` if you don't want to output the value of the TV itself.
modx.modifier.cssToHead: Put a `<link>` element into , where the input value is placed inside the href attribute. Uses [modX.regClientCSS](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extending-modx/modx-class/reference/modx.regclientcss).
modx.modifier.htmlToHead: Insert a block of HTML code in the header of the page, before `</head>`. Uses [modX.regClientStartupHTMLBlock](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extending-modx/modx-class/reference/modx.regclientstartuphtmlblock).
modx.modifier.htmlToBottom: Insert HTML code at the end of the page, before `</body>`. Uses [modX.regClientHTMLBlock](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extending-modx/modx-class/reference/modx.regclienthtmlblock).
modx.modifier.jsToHead: Insert JS code (or a link) in the header of the page, before `</head>`. Uses [modX.regClientStartupScript](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extending-modx/modx-class/reference/modx.regclientstartupscript).
modx.modifier.jsToBottom: Insert JS code (or a link) at the end of the page, before `</body>`. Uses [modX.regClientScript](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extending-modx/modx-class/reference/modx.regclientscript).
modx.modifier.urlencode: Converts the input into a URL-friendly string similar to how an HTML form would do so. Similar to PHP's [urlencode](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.urlencode.php).
modx.modifier.urldecode: Converts the input from an URL-friendly string Similar to PHP's [urldecode](http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.urldecode.php).
modx.modifier.filterPathSegment: Added in 2.7. Converts the input into a URL-friendly string with the same mechanism that turns a pagetitle into an alias, including transliteration if enabled. Useful for custom urls.
fenom.modifier.upper: Modifier is used to uppercase a variable or string. This is equivalent to the PHP [strtoupper()](http://docs.php.net/strtoupper) function.
fenom.modifier.lower: Modifier is used to lowercase a variable or string. This is equivalent to the PHP [strtolower()](http://docs.php.net/lower) function.
fenom.modifier.date_format: This formats a date and time into the given [strftime()](http://docs.php.net/strftime) format. Dates can be passed to Fenom as unix timestamps, DateTime objects or any string made up of month day year, parsable by [strftime()](http://docs.php.net/strftime). By default format is: `%b %e, %Y`.
fenom.modifier.date: This formats a date and time into the given [date()](http://docs.php.net/date) format.
fenom.modifier.truncate: Modifier truncates a variable to a character length.
fenom.modifier.escape: The modifier escapes a string for safe insertion into the output. It supports different escaping strategies depending on the template context. By default, it uses the HTML escaping strategy.
fenom.modifier.unescape: `Unescape` is used to decode entity, html, js and URI. See [escape](https://github.com/fenom-template/fenom/blob/master/docs/en/mods/escape.md).
fenom.modifier.strip: This replaces all repeated spaces and tabs with a single space, or with the supplied string.
fenom.modifier.length: The modifier returns the number of items of a sequence or mapping, or the length of a string (works with UTF8 without `mbstring`).
fenom.modifier.in: The modifier is implementation of [in](https://github.com/fenom-template/fenom/blob/master/docs/en/operators.md#containment-operator) operator (performs containment test).
fenom.modifier.match: Match string against a pattern. The average user may be used to shell patterns or at least in their simplest form to `?` and `*` wildcards so using `match` instead of `ematch` for frontend search expression input may be way more convenient for non-programming users.
fenom.modifier.ematch: Perform a regular expression match. [Read more](http://www.php.net/manual/en/reference.pcre.pattern.syntax.php) about regular expression.
fenom.modifier.replace: Replace all occurrences of the search string with the replacement string.
fenom.modifier.ereplace: Perform a regular expression search and replace. [Read more](http://www.php.net/manual/en/reference.pcre.pattern.syntax.php) about regular expression.
fenom.modifier.esplit: Split string by a regular expression. [Read more](http://www.php.net/manual/en/reference.pcre.pattern.syntax.php) about regular expression.
fenom.modifier.join: Join array elements with a string.
fenom.modifier.number: Formatting a number with PHP's [number_format()](https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.number-format.php) function.
fenom.modifier.md5: String checksum calculation by MD5 algorithm.
fenom.modifier.sha1: String checksum calculation by SHA1 algorithm.
fenom.modifier.crc32: Calculates the CRC32 polynomial for the string.
fenom.modifier.base64_encode: Encodes data into MIME base64 format.
fenom.modifier.toJSON: Returns a JSON representation of the data.
fenom.modifier.print_r: Print out a variable through a PHP function. If a parameter is passed, you can save the result.
fenom.modifier.var_dump: Printing a variable together with the type.
fenom.modifier.nl2br: Inserts HTML line break code before each line break translation.
fenom.modifier.ucwords: Converts the first character of each word in the string to uppercase and the remaining characters to lowercase.
fenom.modifier.ucfirst: Converts the first character of the first word in the string to uppercase and the remaining characters to lower case.
fenom.modifier.htmlent: Converts all possible characters into corresponding HTML entities.
fenom.modifier.limit: Trim a string to the specified number of characters.
fenom.modifier.notags: Removing HTML tags from a string.
fenom.modifier.stripmodxtags: Removing MODX tags from a string.
fenom.modifier.cdata: Envelopes the output with CDATA tags. This is usually needed to escape values in XML markup.
fenom.modifier.reverse: Reverses the string character by character.
fenom.modifier.wordwrap: Inserts a line break after every nth character (words are not broken).
fenom.modifier.wordwrapcut: Inserts a line break after every nth character, even if that character will be inside a word.
fenom.modifier.fuzzydate: Outputs the date relative to today and yesterday using the system dictionaries. If more than 2 days have passed, it formats the date using `strftime`..
fenom.modifier.declension: Declines the word following the number according to the rules of the Russian language. For example: 1 apple, 2 apples, 10 apples. The second parameter specifies whether to output the number itself; by default, only the matching variant of the word is output. Separator of variants can be specified by the third parameter, by default `|`.
fenom.modifier.ismember: Check if the user belongs to a MODX user group(s). If the variable is empty, the check is performed for the current user.
fenom.modifier.isloggedin: Checks if the current user is authorized in the context. If no context is specified, the current one is checked.
fenom.modifier.url: Generating a link to a system document via `modX::makeUrl`.
fenom.modifier.lexicon: Output of entries from system dictionaries via `modX::lexicon`. Some dictionaries need to be loaded beforehand.
fenom.modifier.resource: Output the resource field. You can also output TV's.
fenom.modifier.print: Function for printing and escaping any variables. Very handy to use for debugging when you want to know what is inside. The only parameter specifies whether to wrap the data in a `<pre>` tag (default is true).
fenom.modifier.setOption: Putting a value into the `modX::config` array. It is obligatory to specify the key of the value in the array.
fenom.modifier.option: Get the value from the `modX::config` array.
fenom.modifier.setPlaceholder: Sets the value to the `modX::placeholders` array. It is mandatory to specify the key of the value in the array.
fenom.modifier.placeholder: Getting a value from the `modX::placeholders` array.
fenom.modifier.cssToHead: Put a `<link>` element into , where the input value is placed inside the href attribute. Uses [modX.regClientCSS](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extending-modx/modx-class/reference/modx.regclientcss).
fenom.modifier.htmlToHead: Insert a block of HTML code in the header of the page, before `</head>`. Uses [modX.regClientStartupHTMLBlock](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extending-modx/modx-class/reference/modx.regclientstartuphtmlblock).
fenom.modifier.htmlToBottom: Insert HTML code at the end of the page, before `</body>`. Uses [modX.regClientHTMLBlock](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extending-modx/modx-class/reference/modx.regclienthtmlblock).
fenom.modifier.jsToHead: Insert JS code (or a link) in the header of the page, before `</head>`. Uses [modX.regClientStartupScript](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extending-modx/modx-class/reference/modx.regclientstartupscript). If you pass `true` as a parameter, you can register the plain code.
fenom.modifier.jsToBottom: Insert JS code (or a link) at the end of the page, before `</body>`. Uses [modX.regClientScript](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extending-modx/modx-class/reference/modx.regclientscript). If you pass `true` as a parameter, you can register the plain code.
fenom.modifier.preg_quote:
Adds a backslash before each service character. This can be useful if the template includes string variables whose value may change during script execution. The following characters are considered as service characters in regular expressions:
`. \ + * ? [ ^ ] $ ( ) { } = ! < > | : -`
fenom.modifier.preg_get: Searches the regular expression, the result contains the first set of occurrences.
fenom.modifier.preg_get_all: Searches the regular expression, the result contains the set of all occurrences.
fenom.modifier.preg_grep: Returns an array of occurrences that match the pattern.
fenom.modifier.preg_replace: Performs search and replace on a regular expression.
fenom.modifier.preg_filter: Performs search and replace on a regular expression identical to `preg_replace` except that it returns only those values in which a match is found.
fenom.modifier.preg_split: Splits a string by regular expression.
setting.access_category_enabled: Check Category Access Use this to enable or disable Category ACL checks (per Context). NOTE: If this option is set to no, then ALL Category Access Permissions will be ignored!
setting.access_context_enabled: Check Context Access Use this to enable or disable Context ACL checks. NOTE: If this option is set to no, then ALL Context Access Permissions will be ignored. DO NOT disable this system-wide or for the mgr Context or you will disable access to the manager interface.
setting.access_resource_group_enabled: Check Resource Group Access Use this to enable or disable Resource Group ACL checks (per Context). NOTE: If this option is set to no, then ALL Resource Group Access Permissions will be ignored!
setting.allow_mgr_access: Manager Interface Access Select this option to enable or disable access to the manager interface. NOTE: If this option is set to no, then the user will be redirected to the Manager Login Startup or to the Site Start web page.
setting.failed_login:
Failed Login Attempts

Here you can enter the number of failed login attempts that are allowed before a user is blocked.
setting.login_allowed_days:
Allowed Days

Select the days that this user is allowed to login.
setting.login_allowed_ip: Allowed IP Address Enter the IP addresses that this user is allowed to log in from. NOTE: Separate multiple IP addresses with a comma (,)
setting.login_homepage: Login Home Page Enter the ID of the document you want to send the user to after he/she has logged in. NOTE: Make sure the ID you enter belongs to an existing document, and that it has been published and is accessible by this user!
setting.access_policies_version:
Access Policy Schema Version

The version of the Access Policy system. DO NOT CHANGE.
setting.allow_forward_across_contexts:
Allow Forwarding Across Contexts

When true, Symlinks and modX::sendForward() API calls can forward requests to Resources in other Contexts.
setting.allow_manager_login_forgot_passw:
Allow Forgot Password in Manager Login Screen

Setting this to "No" will disable the forgot password ability on the manager login screen.
setting.allow_tags_in_post:
Allow Tags in POST

If false, all POST variables will be stripped of HTML script tags, numeric entities, and MODX tags. MODX recommends to leave this set to false for Contexts other than mgr, where it is set to true by default.
setting.allow_tv_eval:
Enable eval in TV bindings

Select this option to enable or disable eval in TV bindings. If this option is set to no, the code/value will just be handled as regular text.
setting.anonymous_sessions:
Anonymous Sessions

If disabled, only authenticated users will have access to a PHP session. This can reduce overhead for anonymous users and the load they impose on a MODX site if they do not need access to a unique session. If session_enabled is false, this setting has no effect as sessions would never be available.
setting.archive_with:
Force PCLZip Archives

If true, will use PCLZip instead of ZipArchive as the zip extension. Turn this on if you are getting extractTo errors or are having problems with unzipping in Package Management.
setting.auto_menuindex:
Menu indexing default

Select 'Yes' to turn on automatic menu index incrementing by default.
setting.auto_check_pkg_updates:
Automatic Check for Package Updates

If 'Yes', MODX will automatically check for updates for packages in Package Management. This may slow the loading of the grid.
setting.auto_check_pkg_updates_cache_exp:
Cache Expiration Time for Automatic Package Updates Check

The number of minutes that Package Management will cache the results for checking for package updates.
setting.allow_multiple_emails:
Allow Duplicate Emails for Users

If enabled, Users may share the same email address.
setting.automatic_alias:
Automatically generate alias

Select 'Yes' to have the system automatically generate an alias based on the Resource's page title when saving.
setting.automatic_template_assignment:
Automatic Template Assignment

Choose how templates are assigned to new Resources on creation. Options include: system (default template from system settings), parent (inherits the parent template), or sibling (inherits the most used sibling template)
setting.base_help_url:
Base Help URL

The base URL by which to build the Help links in the top right of pages in the manager.
setting.blocked_minutes:
Blocked Minutes

Here you can enter the number of minutes that a user will be blocked for if they reach their maximum number of allowed failed login attempts. Please enter this value as numbers only (no commas, spaces etc.)
setting.cache_action_map:
Enable Action Map Cache

When enabled, actions (or controller maps) will be cached to reduce manager page load times.
setting.cache_alias_map:
Enable Context Alias Map Cache

When enabled, all Resource URIs are cached into the Context. Enable on smaller sites and disable on larger sites for better performance.
setting.use_context_resource_table:
Use the context resource table for context cache refreshes

When enabled, context cache refreshes use the context_resource table. This enables you to programmatically have one resource in multiple contexts. If you do not use those multiple resource contexts via the API, you can set this to false. On large sites you will get a potential performance boost in the manager then.
setting.cache_context_settings:
Enable Context Setting Cache

When enabled, context settings will be cached to reduce load times.
setting.cache_db:
Enable Database Cache

When enabled, objects and raw result sets from SQL queries are cached to significantly reduce database loads.
setting.cache_db_expires:
Expiration Time for DB Cache

This value (in seconds) sets the amount of time cache files last for DB result-set caching.
setting.cache_db_session:
Enable Database Session Cache

When enabled, and cache_db is enabled, database sessions will be cached in the DB result-set cache.
setting.cache_db_session_lifetime:
Expiration Time for DB Session Cache

This value (in seconds) sets the amount of time cache files last for session entries in the DB result-set cache.
setting.cache_default:
Cacheable default

Select 'Yes' to make all new Resources cacheable by default.
setting.cache_expires:
Expiration Time for Default Cache

This value (in seconds) sets the amount of time cache files last for default caching.
setting.cache_resource_clear_partial:
Clear Partial Resource Cache for provided contexts

When enabled, MODX refresh will only clear resource cache for the provided contexts.
setting.cache_format:
Caching Format to Use

0 = PHP, 1 = JSON, 2 = serialize. One of the formats
setting.cache_handler:
Caching Handler Class

The class name of the type handler to use for caching.
setting.cache_lang_js:
Cache Lexicon JS Strings

If set to true, this will use server headers to cache the lexicon strings loaded into JavaScript for the manager interface.
setting.cache_lexicon_topics:
Cache Lexicon Topics

When enabled, all Lexicon Topics will be cached so as to greatly reduce load times for Internationalization functionality. MODX strongly recommends leaving this set to 'Yes'.
setting.cache_noncore_lexicon_topics:
Cache Non-Core Lexicon Topics

When disabled, non-core Lexicon Topics will be not be cached. This is useful to disable when developing your own Extras.
setting.cache_resource:
Enable Partial Resource Cache

Partial resource caching is configurable by resource when this feature is enabled.  Disabling this feature will disable it globally.
setting.cache_resource_expires:
Expiration Time for Partial Resource Cache

This value (in seconds) sets the amount of time cache files last for partial Resource caching.
setting.cache_scripts:
Enable Script Cache

When enabled, MODX will cache all Scripts (Snippets and Plugins) to file to reduce load times. MODX recommends leaving this set to 'Yes'.
setting.cache_system_settings:
Enable System Setting Cache

When enabled, system settings will be cached to reduce load times. MODX recommends leaving this on.
setting.clear_cache_refresh_trees:
Refresh Trees on Site Cache Clear

When enabled, will refresh the trees after clearing the site cache.
setting.compress_css:
Use Compressed CSS

When this is enabled, MODX will use a compressed version of its CSS stylesheets in the manager interface.
setting.compress_js:
Use Compressed JavaScript Libraries

When this is enabled, MODX will serve a compressed version of the core scripts file.
setting.compress_js_groups:
Use Grouping When Compressing JavaScript

Group the core MODX manager JavaScript using minify's groupsConfig. Set to Yes if using suhosin or other limiting factors.
setting.compress_js_max_files:
Maximum JavaScript Files Compression Threshold

The maximum number of JavaScript files MODX will attempt to compress at once when compress_js is on. Set to a lower number if you are experiencing issues with Google Minify in the manager.
setting.concat_js:
Use Concatenated Javascript Libraries

When this is enabled, MODX will use a concatenated version of its common JavaScript libraries in the manager interface. This greatly reduces load and execution time within the manager. Disable only if you are modifying core elements.
setting.confirm_navigation:
Confirm Navigation with unsaved changes

When this is enabled, the user will be prompted to confirm their intention if there are unsaved changes.
setting.container_suffix:
Container Suffix

The suffix to append to Resources set as containers when using FURLs.
setting.context_tree_sort:
Enable Sorting of Contexts in Resource Tree

If set to Yes, Contexts will be alphanumerically sorted in the left-hand Resources tree.
setting.context_tree_sortby:
Sort Field of Contexts in Resource Tree

The field to sort Contexts by in the Resources tree, if sorting is enabled.
setting.context_tree_sortdir:
Sort Direction of Contexts in Resource Tree

The direction to sort Contexts in the Resources tree, if sorting is enabled.
setting.cultureKey:
Language

Select the language for all non-manager Contexts, including web.
setting.date_timezone:
Default Time Zone

Controls the default timezone setting for PHP date functions, if not empty. If empty and the PHP date.timezone ini setting is not set in your environment, UTC will be assumed.
setting.debug:
Debug

Controls turning debugging on/off in MODX and/or sets the PHP error_reporting level. '' = use current error_reporting, '0' = false (error_reporting = 0), '1' = true (error_reporting = -1), or any valid error_reporting value (as an integer).
setting.default_content_type:
Default Content Type

Select the default Content Type you wish to use for new Resources. You can still select a different Content Type in the Resource editor; this setting just pre-selects one of your Content Types for you.
setting.default_duplicate_publish_option:
Default Duplicate Resource Publishing Option

The default selected option when duplicating a Resource. Can be either "unpublish" to unpublish all duplicates, "publish" to publish all duplicates, or "preserve" to preserve the publish state based on the duplicated Resource.
setting.default_media_source:
Default Media Source

The default Media Source to load.
setting.default_media_source_type:
Default Media Source Type

The default selected Media Source Type when creating a new Media Source.
setting.default_template:
Default Template

Select the default Template you wish to use for new Resources. You can still select a different template in the Resource editor, this setting just pre-selects one of your Templates for you.
setting.default_per_page:
Default Per Page

The default number of results to show in grids throughout the manager.
setting.editor_css_path:
Path to CSS file

Enter the path to your CSS file that you wish to use within a richtext editor. The best way to enter the path is to enter the path from the root of your server, for example: /assets/site/style.css. If you do not wish to load a style sheet into a richtext editor, leave this field blank.
setting.editor_css_selectors:
CSS Selectors for Editor

A comma-separated list of CSS selectors for a richtext editor.
setting.emailsender:
Registration Email From Address

Here you can specify the email address used when sending Users their usernames and passwords.
setting.emailsubject:
Registration Email Subject

The subject line for the default signup email when a User is registered.
setting.enable_dragdrop:
Enable Drag/Drop in Resource/Element Trees

If off, will prevent dragging and dropping in Resource and Element trees.
setting.error_page: Error Page Enter the ID of the document you want to send users to if they request a document which doesn't actually exist (404 Page Not Found). NOTE: make sure this ID you enter belongs to an existing document, and that it has been published!
setting.ext_debug:
ExtJS debug

Whether or not to load ext-all-debug.js to help debug your ExtJS code.
setting.extension_packages:
Extension Packages

A JSON array of packages to load on MODX instantiation. In the format [{"packagename":{"path":"path/to/package"}},{"anotherpackagename":{"path":"path/to/otherpackage"}}]
setting.enable_gravatar:
Enable Gravatar

If enabled, Gravatar will be used as a profile image (if user do not have profile photo uploaded).
setting.failed_login_attempts:
Failed Login Attempts

The number of failed login attempts a User is allowed before becoming 'blocked'.
setting.fe_editor_lang:
Front-end Editor Language

Choose a language for the editor to use when used as a front-end editor.
setting.feed_modx_news:
MODX News Feed URL

Set the URL for the RSS feed for the MODX News panel in the manager.
setting.feed_modx_news_enabled:
MODX News Feed Enabled

If 'No', MODX will hide the News feed in the welcome section of the manager.
setting.feed_modx_security:
MODX Security Notices Feed URL

Set the URL for the RSS feed for the MODX Security Notices panel in the manager.
setting.feed_modx_security_enabled:
MODX Security Feed Enabled

If 'No', MODX will hide the Security feed in the welcome section of the manager.
setting.filemanager_path:
File Manager Path (Deprecated)

Deprecated - use Media Sources instead. IIS often does not populate the document_root setting properly, which is used by the file manager to determine what you can look at. If you're having problems using the file manager, make sure this path points to the root of your MODX installation.
setting.filemanager_path_relative:
Is File Manager Path Relative? (Deprecated)

Deprecated - use Media Sources instead. If your filemanager_path setting is relative to the MODX base_path, then please set this setting to Yes. If your filemanager_path is outside the docroot, set this to No.
setting.filemanager_url:
File Manager Url (Deprecated)

Deprecated - use Media Sources instead. Optional. Set this if you want to set an explicit URL to access the files in the MODX file manager from (useful if you have changed filemanager_path to a path outside the MODX webroot). Make sure this is the web-accessible URL of the filemanager_path setting value. If you leave this empty, MODX will try to automatically calculate it.
setting.filemanager_url_relative:
Is File Manager URL Relative? (Deprecated)

Deprecated - use Media Sources instead. If your filemanager_url setting is relative to the MODX base_url, then please set this setting to Yes. If your filemanager_url is outside the main webroot, set this to No.
setting.forgot_login_email:
Forgot Login Email

The template for the email that is sent when a user has forgotten their MODX username and/or password.
setting.form_customization_use_all_group:
Use All User Group Memberships for Form Customization

If set to true, FC will use *all* Sets for *all* User Groups a member is in when applying Form Customization Sets. Otherwise, it will only use the Set belonging to the User's Primary Group. Note: setting this to Yes might cause bugs with conflicting FC Sets.
setting.forward_merge_excludes:
sendForward Exclude Fields on Merge

A Symlink merges non-empty field values over the values in the target Resource; using this comma-delimited list of excludes prevents specified fields from being overridden by the Symlink.
setting.friendly_alias_lowercase_only:
FURL Lowercase Aliases

Determines whether to allow only lowercase characters in a Resource alias.
setting.friendly_alias_max_length:
FURL Alias Maximum Length

If greater than zero, the maximum number of characters to allow in a Resource alias. Zero equals unlimited.
setting.friendly_alias_realtime:
FURL Alias Real-Time

Determines whether a resource alias should be created on the fly when typing the pagetitle or if this should happen when the resource is saved (automatic_alias needs to be enabled for this to have an effect).
setting.friendly_alias_restrict_chars:
FURL Alias Character Restriction Method

The method used to restrict characters used in a Resource alias. "pattern" allows a RegEx pattern to be provided, "legal" allows any legal URL characters, "alpha" allows only letters of the alphabet, and "alphanumeric" allows only letters and numbers.
setting.friendly_alias_restrict_chars_pa:
FURL Alias Character Restriction Pattern

A valid RegEx pattern for restricting characters used in a Resource alias.
setting.friendly_alias_strip_element_tag:
FURL Alias Strip Element Tags

Determines if Element tags should be stripped from a Resource alias.
setting.friendly_alias_translit:
FURL Alias Transliteration

The method of transliteration to use on an alias specified for a Resource. Empty or "none" is the default which skips transliteration. Other possible values are "iconv" (if available) or a named transliteration table provided by a custom transliteration service class.
setting.friendly_alias_translit_class:
FURL Alias Transliteration Service Class

An optional service class to provide named transliteration services for FURL Alias generation/filtering.
setting.friendly_alias_translit_class_pa:
FURL Alias Transliteration Service Class Path

The model package location where the FURL Alias Transliteration Service Class will be loaded from.
setting.friendly_alias_trim_chars:
FURL Alias Trim Characters

Characters to trim from the ends of a provided Resource alias.
setting.friendly_alias_word_delimiter:
FURL Alias Word Delimiter

The preferred word delimiter for friendly URL alias slugs.
setting.friendly_alias_word_delimiters:
FURL Alias Word Delimiters

Characters which represent word delimiters when processing friendly URL alias slugs. These characters will be converted and consolidated to the preferred FURL alias word delimiter.
setting.friendly_urls:
Use Friendly URLs

This allows you to use search engine friendly URLs with MODX. Please note, this only works for MODX installations running on Apache, and you'll need to write an .htaccess file for this to work. See the .htaccess file included in the distribution for more info.
setting.friendly_urls_strict:
Use Strict Friendly URLs

When friendly URLs are enabled, this option forces non-canonical requests that match a Resource to 301 redirect to the canonical URI for that Resource. WARNING: Do not enable if you use custom rewrite rules which do not match at least the beginning of the canonical URI. For example, a canonical URI of foo/ with custom rewrites for foo/bar.html would work, but attempts to rewrite bar/foo.html as foo/ would force a redirect to foo/ with this option enabled.
setting.global_duplicate_uri_check:
Check for Duplicate URIs Across All Contexts

Select 'Yes' to make duplicate URI checks include all Contexts in the search. Otherwise, only the Context the Resource is being saved in is checked.
setting.hidemenu_default:
Hide From Menus Default

Select 'Yes' to make all new resources hidden from menus by default.
setting.inline_help:
Show Inline Help Text for Fields

If 'Yes', then fields will display their help text directly below the field. If 'No', all fields will have tooltip-based help.
setting.link_tag_scheme: URL Generation Scheme URL generation scheme for tag [[~id]]. Available options here.
setting.locale: Locale Set the locale for the system. Leave blank to use the default. See the PHP documentation for more information.
setting.lock_ttl:
Lock Time-to-Live

The number of seconds a lock on a Resource will remain for if the user is inactive.
setting.log_level:
Logging Level

The default logging level; the lower the level, the fewer messages that are logged. Available options: 0 (FATAL), 1 (ERROR), 2 (WARN), 3 (INFO), and 4 (DEBUG).
setting.log_target:
Logging Target

The default logging target where log messages are written. Available options: 'FILE', 'HTML', or 'ECHO'. Default is 'FILE' if not specified.
setting.log_deprecated:
Log Deprecated Functions

Enable to receive notices in your error log when deprecated functions are used.
setting.mail_charset:
Mail Charset

The default charset for emails, e.g., 'iso-8859-1' or 'utf-8'
setting.mail_encoding:
Mail Encoding

Sets the Encoding of the message. Options for this are "8bit", "7bit", "binary", "base64", and "quoted-printable".
setting.mail_use_smtp:
Use SMTP

If true, MODX will attempt to use SMTP in mail functions.
setting.mail_smtp_auth:
SMTP Authentication

Sets SMTP authentication. Utilizes the mail_smtp_user and mail_smtp_pass settings.
setting.mail_smtp_helo:
SMTP Helo Message

Sets the SMTP HELO of the message (Defaults to the hostname).
setting.mail_smtp_hosts:
SMTP Hosts

Sets the SMTP hosts.  All hosts must be separated by a semicolon.  You can also specify a different port for each host by using this format: [hostname:port] (e.g., "smtp1.example.com:25;smtp2.example.com"). Hosts will be tried in order.
setting.mail_smtp_keepalive:
SMTP Keep-Alive

Prevents the SMTP connection from being closed after each mail sending. Not recommended.
setting.mail_smtp_pass:
SMTP Password

The password to authenticate to SMTP against.
setting.mail_smtp_port:
SMTP Port

Sets the default SMTP server port.
setting.mail_smtp_prefix:
SMTP Encryption

Sets the encryption of the SMTP connection. Options are "", "ssl" or "tls"
setting.mail_smtp_autotls:
SMTP Auto TLS

Whether to enable TLS encryption automatically if a server supports it, even if "SMTP Encryption" is not set to "tls"
setting.mail_smtp_single_to:
SMTP Single To

Provides the ability to have the TO field process individual emails, instead of sending to entire TO addresses.
setting.mail_smtp_timeout:
SMTP Timeout

Sets the SMTP server timeout in seconds. This function will not work in win32 servers.
setting.mail_smtp_user:
SMTP User

The user to authenticate to SMTP against.
setting.main_nav_parent:
Main menu parent

The container used to pull all records for the main menu.
setting.manager_direction:
Manager Text Direction

Choose the direction that the text will be rendered in the Manager, left to right or right to left.
setting.manager_date_format:
Manager Date Format

The format string, in PHP date() format, for the dates represented in the manager.
setting.manager_favicon_url:
Manager Favicon URL

If set, will load this URL as a favicon for the MODX manager. Must be a relative URL to the manager/ directory, or an absolute URL.
setting.manager_js_cache_file_locking:
Enable File Locking for Manager JS/CSS Cache

Cache file locking. Set to No if filesystem is NFS.
setting.manager_js_cache_max_age:
Manager JS/CSS Compression Cache Age

Maximum age of browser cache of manager CSS/JS compression in seconds. After this period, the browser will send another conditional GET. Use a longer period for lower traffic.
setting.manager_js_document_root:
Manager JS/CSS Compression Document Root

If your server does not handle the DOCUMENT_ROOT server variable, set it explicitly here to enable the manager CSS/JS compression. Do not change this unless you know what you are doing.
setting.manager_js_zlib_output_compressi:
Enable zlib Output Compression for Manager JS/CSS

Whether or not to enable zlib output compression for compressed CSS/JS in the manager. Do not turn this on unless you are sure the PHP config variable zlib.output_compression can be set to 1. MODX recommends leaving it off.
setting.manager_lang_attribute:
Manager HTML and XML Language Attribute

Enter the language code that best fits with your chosen manager language, this will ensure that the browser can present content in the best format for you.
setting.manager_language:
Manager Language

Select the language for the MODX Content Manager.
setting.manager_login_url_alternate:
Alternate Manager Login URL

An alternate URL to send an unauthenticated user to when they need to login to the manager. The login form there must login the user to the "mgr" context to work.
setting.manager_login_start: Manager Login Startup Enter the ID of the document you want to send the user to after he/she has logged into the manager. NOTE: make sure the ID you've entered belongs to an existing document, and that it has been published and is accessible by this user!
setting.manager_theme:
Manager Theme

Select the Theme for the Content Manager.
setting.manager_time_format:
Manager Time Format

The format string, in PHP date() format, for the time settings represented in the manager.
setting.manager_use_tabs:
Use Tabs in Manager Layout

If true, the manager will use tabs for rendering the content panes. Otherwise, it will use portals.
setting.manager_week_start:
Week start

Define the day starting the week. Use 0 (or leave empty) for sunday, 1 for monday and so on...
setting.mgr_tree_icon_context:
Context tree icon

Define a CSS class here to be used to display the context icon in the tree. You can use this setting on each context to customize the icon per context.
setting.mgr_source_icon:
Media Source icon

Indicate a CSS class to be used to display the Media Sources icons in the files tree. Defaults to "icon-folder-open-o"
setting.modx_browser_tree_hide_files:
Media Browser Tree Hide Files

If true the files inside folders are not displayed in the Media Browser source tree.
setting.modx_browser_tree_hide_tooltips:
Media Browser Tree Hide Tooltips

If true, no image preview tooltips are shown when hovering over a file in the Media Browser tree. Defaults to true.
setting.modx_browser_default_sort:
Media Browser Default Sort

The default sort method when using the Media Browser in the manager. Available values are: name, size, lastmod (last modified).
setting.modx_browser_default_viewmode:
Media Browser Default View Mode

The default view mode when using the Media Browser in the manager. Available values are: grid, list.
setting.modx_charset:
Character encoding

Please select which character encoding you wish to use. Please note that MODX has been tested with a number of these encodings, but not all of them. For most languages, the default setting of UTF-8 is preferable.
setting.new_file_permissions:
New File Permissions

When uploading a new file in the File Manager, the File Manager will attempt to change the file permissions to those entered in this setting. This may not work on some setups, such as IIS, in which case you will need to manually change the permissions.
setting.new_folder_permissions:
New Folder Permissions

When creating a new folder in the File Manager, the File Manager will attempt to change the folder permissions to those entered in this setting. This may not work on some setups, such as IIS, in which case you will need to manually change the permissions.
setting.parser_recurse_uncacheable:
Delay Uncacheable Parsing

If disabled, uncacheable elements may have their output cached inside cacheable element content. Disable this ONLY if you are having problems with complex nested parsing which stopped working as expected.
setting.password_generated_length:
Password Auto-Generated Length

The length of the auto-generated password for a User.
setting.password_min_length:
Minimum Password Length

The minimum length for a password for a User.
setting.preserve_menuindex:
Preserve Menu Index When Duplicating Resources

When duplicating Resources, the menu index order will also be preserved.
setting.principal_targets:
ACL Targets to Load

Customize the ACL targets to load for MODX Users.
setting.proxy_auth_type:
Proxy Authentication Type

Supports either BASIC or NTLM.
setting.proxy_host:
Proxy Host

If your server is using a proxy, set the hostname here to enable MODX features that might need to use the proxy, such as Package Management.
setting.proxy_password:
Proxy Password

The password required to authenticate to your proxy server.
setting.proxy_port:
Proxy Port

The port for your proxy server.
setting.proxy_username:
Proxy Username

The username to authenticate against with your proxy server.
setting.photo_profile_source:
User photo Media Source

The Media Source used to store users profiles photos. Defaults to default Media Source.
setting.phpthumb_allow_src_above_docroot:
phpThumb Allow src Above Document Root

Indicates if the src path is allowed outside the document root. This is useful for multi-context deployments with multiple virtual hosts.
setting.phpthumb_cache_maxage:
phpThumb Max Cache Age

Delete cached thumbnails that have not been accessed in more than X days.
setting.phpthumb_cache_maxsize:
phpThumb Max Cache Size

Delete least-recently-accessed thumbnails when cache grows bigger than X megabytes in size.
setting.phpthumb_cache_maxfiles:
phpThumb Max Cache Files

Delete least-recently-accessed thumbnails when cache has more than X files.
setting.phpthumb_cache_source_enabled:
phpThumb Cache Source Files

Whether or not to cache source files as they are loaded. Recommended to off.
setting.phpthumb_document_root:
PHPThumb Document Root

Set this if you are experiencing issues with the server variable DOCUMENT_ROOT, or getting errors with OutputThumbnail or !is_resource. Set it to the absolute document root path you would like to use. If this is empty, MODX will use the DOCUMENT_ROOT server variable.
setting.phpthumb_error_bgcolor:
phpThumb Error Background Color

A hex value, without the #, indicating a background color for phpThumb error output.
setting.phpthumb_error_fontsize:
phpThumb Error Font Size

An em value indicating a font size to use for text appearing in phpThumb error output.
setting.phpthumb_error_textcolor:
phpThumb Error Font Color

A hex value, without the #, indicating a font color for text appearing in phpThumb error output.
setting.phpthumb_far:
phpThumb Force Aspect Ratio

The default far setting for phpThumb when used in MODX. Defaults to C to force aspect ratio toward the center.
setting.phpthumb_imagemagick_path:
phpThumb ImageMagick Path

Optional. Set an alternative ImageMagick path here for generating thumbnails with phpThumb, if it is not in the PHP default.
setting.phpthumb_nohotlink_enabled:
phpThumb Hotlinking Disabled

Remote servers are allowed in the src parameter unless you disable hotlinking in phpThumb.
setting.phpthumb_nohotlink_erase_image:
phpThumb Hotlinking Erase Image

Indicates if an image generated from a remote server should be erased when not allowed.
setting.phpthumb_nohotlink_text_message:
phpThumb Hotlinking Not Allowed Message

A message that is rendered instead of the thumbnail when a hotlinking attempt is rejected.
setting.phpthumb_nohotlink_valid_domains:
phpThumb Hotlinking Valid Domains

A comma-delimited list of hostnames that are valid in src URLs.
setting.phpthumb_nooffsitelink_enabled:
phpThumb Offsite Linking Disabled

Disables the ability for others to use phpThumb to render images on their own sites.
setting.phpthumb_nooffsitelink_erase_ima:
phpThumb Offsite Linking Erase Image

Indicates if an image linked from a remote server should be erased when not allowed.
setting.phpthumb_nooffsitelink_require_r:
phpThumb Offsite Linking Require Referrer

If enabled, any offsite linking attempts will be rejected without a valid referrer header.
setting.phpthumb_nooffsitelink_text_mess:
phpThumb Offsite Linking Not Allowed Message

A message that is rendered instead of the thumbnail when an offsite linking attempt is rejected.
setting.phpthumb_nooffsitelink_valid_dom:
phpThumb Offsite Linking Valid Domains

A comma-delimited list of hostnames that are valid referrers for offsite linking.
setting.phpthumb_nooffsitelink_watermark:
phpThumb Offsite Linking Watermark Source

Optional. A valid file system path to a file to use as a watermark source when your images are rendered offsite by phpThumb.
setting.phpthumb_zoomcrop:
phpThumb Zoom-Crop

The default zc setting for phpThumb when used in MODX. Defaults to 0 to prevent zoom cropping.
setting.publish_default:
Published default

Select 'Yes' to make all new resources published by default.
setting.rb_base_dir: Resource path Enter the physical path to the resource directory. This setting is usually automatically generated. If you're using IIS, however, MODX may not be able to work the path out on its own, causing the Resource Browser to show an error. In that case, you can enter the path to the images directory here (the path as you'd see it in Windows Explorer). NOTE: The resource directory must contain the subfolders images, files, flash and media in order for the resource browser to function correctly.
setting.rb_base_url:
Resource URL

Enter the virtual path to resource directory. This setting is usually automatically generated. If you're using IIS, however, MODX may not be able to work the URL out on its own, causing the Resource Browser to show an error. In that case, you can enter the URL to the images directory here (the URL as you'd enter it on Internet Explorer).
setting.request_controller:
Request Controller Filename

The filename of the main request controller from which MODX is loaded. Most users can leave this as index.php.
setting.request_method_strict:
Strict Request Method

If enabled, requests via the Request ID Parameter will be ignored with FURLs enabled, and those via Request Alias Parameter will be ignored without FURLs enabled.
setting.request_param_alias:
Request Alias Parameter

The name of the GET parameter to identify Resource aliases when redirecting with FURLs.
setting.request_param_id:
Request ID Parameter

The name of the GET parameter to identify Resource IDs when not using FURLs.
setting.resolve_hostnames:
Resolve hostnames

Do you want MODX to try to resolve your visitors' hostnames when they visit your site? Resolving hostnames may create some extra server load, although your visitors won't notice this in any way.
setting.resource_tree_node_name:
Resource Tree Node Field

Specify the Resource field to use when rendering the nodes in the Resource Tree. Defaults to pagetitle, although any Resource field can be used, such as menutitle, alias, longtitle, etc.
setting.resource_tree_node_name_fallback:
Resource Tree Node Fallback Field

Specify the Resource field to use as fallback when rendering the nodes in the Resource Tree. This will be used if the resource has an empty value for the configured Resource Tree Node Field.
setting.resource_tree_node_tooltip:
Resource Tree Tooltip Field

Specify the Resource field to use when rendering the nodes in the Resource Tree. Any Resource field can be used, such as menutitle, alias, longtitle, etc. If blank, will be the longtitle with a description underneath.
setting.richtext_default:
Richtext Default

Select 'Yes' to make all new Resources use the Richtext Editor by default.
setting.search_default:
Searchable Default

Select 'Yes' to make all new resources searchable by default.
setting.server_offset_time:
Server offset time

Select the number of hours time difference between where you are and where the server is.
setting.server_protocol:
Server type

If your site is on a https connection, please specify so here.
setting.session_cookie_domain:
Session Cookie Domain

Use this setting to customize the session cookie domain. Leave blank to use the current domain.
setting.session_cookie_lifetime:
Session Cookie Lifetime

Use this setting to customize the session cookie lifetime in seconds.  This is used to set the lifetime of a client session cookie when they choose the 'remember me' option on login.
setting.session_cookie_path:
Session Cookie Path

Use this setting to customize the cookie path for identifying site specific session cookies. Leave blank to use MODX_BASE_URL.
setting.session_cookie_secure:
Session Cookie Secure

Enable this setting to use secure session cookies. This requires your site to be accessible over https, otherwise your site and/or manager will become inaccessible.
setting.session_cookie_httponly:
Session Cookie HttpOnly

Use this setting to set the HttpOnly flag on session cookies.
setting.session_cookie_samesite:
Session Cookie Samesite

Choose Lax or Strict.
setting.session_gc_maxlifetime:
Session Garbage Collector Max Lifetime

Allows customization of the session.gc_maxlifetime PHP ini setting when using 'modSessionHandler'.
setting.session_handler_class:
Session Handler Class Name

For database managed sessions, use 'modSessionHandler'.  Leave this blank to use standard PHP session management.
setting.session_name:
Session Name

Use this setting to customize the session name used for the sessions in MODX. Leave blank to use the default PHP session name.
setting.settings_version:
Settings Version

The current installed version of MODX.
setting.settings_distro:
Settings Distribution

The current installed distribution of MODX.
setting.set_header:
Set HTTP Headers

When enabled, MODX will attempt to set the HTTP headers for Resources.
setting.send_poweredby_header:
Send X-Powered-By Header

When enabled, MODX will send the "X-Powered-By" header to identify this site as built on MODX. This helps tracking global MODX usage through third party trackers inspecting your site. Because this makes it easier to identify what your site is built with, it might pose a slightly increased security risk if a vulnerability is found in MODX.
setting.show_tv_categories_header:
Show "Categories" Tabs Header with TVs

If "Yes", MODX will show the "Categories" header above the first category tab when editing TVs in a Resource.
setting.signupemail_message:
Sign-up email Here you can set the message sent to your users when you create an account for them and let MODX send them an email containing their username and password.
Note: The following placeholders are replaced by the Content Manager when the message is sent:

[[+sname]] - Name of your web site,
[[+saddr]] - Your web site email address,
[[+surl]] - Your site URL,
[[+uid]] - User's login name or id,
[[+pwd]] - User's password,
[[+ufn]] - User's full name.

Leave the [[+uid]] and [[+pwd]] in the email, or else the username and password won't be sent in the mail and your users won't know their username or password!
setting.site_name:
Site name

Enter the name of your site here.
setting.site_start: Site start Enter the ID of the Resource you want to use as homepage here. NOTE: make sure this ID you enter belongs to an existing Resource, and that it has been published!
setting.site_status:
Site status

Select 'Yes' to publish your site on the web. If you select 'No', your visitors will see the 'Site unavailable message', and won't be able to browse the site.
setting.site_unavailable_message: Site unavailable message Message to show when the site is offline or if an error occurs. Note: This message will only be displayed if the Site unavailable page option is not set.
setting.site_unavailable_page: Site unavailable page Enter the ID of the Resource you want to use as an offline page here. NOTE: make sure this ID you enter belongs to an existing Resource, and that it has been published!
setting.static_elements_automate_templat:
Automate static elements for templates?

This will automate the handling of static files, such as creating and removing static files for templates.
setting.static_elements_automate_tvs:
Automate static elements for template variables?

This will automate the handling of static files, such as creating and removing static files for template variables.
setting.static_elements_automate_chunks:
Automate static elements for chunks?

This will automate the handling of static files, such as creating and removing static files for chunks.
setting.static_elements_automate_snippet:
Automate static elements for snippets?

This will automate the handling of static files, such as creating and removing static files for snippets.
setting.static_elements_automate_plugins:
Automate static elements for plugins?

This will automate the handling of static files, such as creating and removing static files for plugins.
setting.static_elements_default_mediasou:
Static elements default mediasource

Specify a default mediasource where you want to store the static elements in.
setting.static_elements_default_category:
Static elements default category

Specify a default category for creating new static elements.
setting.static_elements_basepath:
Static elements basepath

Basepath of where to store the static elements files.
setting.resource_static_allow_absolute:
Allow absolute static resource path

This setting enables users to enter a fully qualified absolute path to any readable file on the server as the content of a static resource. Important: enabling this setting may be considered a significant security risk! It's strongly recommended to keep this setting disabled, unless you fully trust every single manager user.
setting.resource_static_path:
Static resource base path

When resource_static_allow_absolute is disabled, static resources are restricted to be within the absolute path provided here.  Important: setting this too wide may allow users to read files they shouldn't! It is strongly recommended to limit users to a specific directory such as {core_path}static/ or {assets_path} with this setting.
setting.strip_image_paths:
Rewrite browser paths?

If this is set to 'No', MODX will write file browser resource src's (images, files, flash, etc.) as absolute URLs. Relative URLs are helpful should you wish to move your MODX install, e.g., from a staging site to a production site. If you have no idea what this means, it's best just to leave it set to 'Yes'.
setting.symlink_merge_fields:
Merge Resource Fields in Symlinks

If set to Yes, will automatically merge non-empty fields with target resource when forwarding using Symlinks.
setting.syncsite_default:
Empty Cache default

Select 'Yes' to empty the cache after you save a resource by default.
setting.topmenu_show_descriptions:
Show Descriptions in Top Menu

If set to 'No', MODX will hide the descriptions from top menu items in the manager.
setting.topmenu_subitems_max:
Maximum items in the drop-down lists of the top menu bar

The maximum number of items displayed in the drop-down lists of the top menu bar. The remaining items will be hidden in the '...' item.
setting.tree_default_sort:
Resource Tree Default Sort Field

The default sort field for the Resource tree when loading the manager.
setting.tree_root_id:
Tree Root ID

Set this to a valid ID of a Resource to start the left Resource tree at below that node as the root. The user will only be able to see Resources that are children of the specified Resource.
setting.tvs_below_content:
Move TVs Below Content

Set this to Yes to move Template Variables below the Content when editing Resources.
setting.ui_debug_mode:
UI Debug Mode

Set this to Yes to output debug messages when using the UI for the default manager theme. You must use a browser that supports console.log.
setting.udperms_allowroot:
Allow root

Do you want to allow your users to create new Resources in the root of the site?
setting.unauthorized_page: Unauthorized page Enter the ID of the Resource you want to send users to if they have requested a secured or unauthorized Resource. NOTE: Make sure the ID you enter belongs to an existing Resource, and that it has been published and is publicly accessible!
setting.upload_check_exists:
Check if uploaded file exists

When enabled an error will be shown when uploading a file that already exists with the same name. When disabled, the existing file will be quietly replaced with the new file.
setting.upload_files:
Uploadable File Types

Here you can enter a list of files that can be uploaded into 'assets/files/' using the Resource Manager. Please enter the extensions for the filetypes, seperated by commas.
setting.upload_flash:
Uploadable Flash Types

Here you can enter a list of files that can be uploaded into 'assets/flash/' using the Resource Manager. Please enter the extensions for the flash types, separated by commas.
setting.upload_images:
Uploadable Image Types

Here you can enter a list of files that can be uploaded into 'assets/images/' using the Resource Manager. Please enter the extensions for the image types, separated by commas.
setting.upload_maxsize: Maximum upload size Enter the maximum file size that can be uploaded via the file manager. Upload file size must be entered in bytes. NOTE: Large files can take a very long time to upload!
setting.upload_media:
Uploadable Media Types

Here you can enter a list of files that can be uploaded into 'assets/media/' using the Resource Manager. Please enter the extensions for the media types, separated by commas.
setting.use_alias_path:
Use Friendly Alias Path Setting this option to 'yes' will display the full path to the Resource if the Resource has an alias. For example, if a Resource with an alias called 'child' is located inside a container Resource with an alias called 'parent', then the full alias path to the Resource will be displayed as '/parent/child.html'.
NOTE: When setting this option to 'Yes' (turning on alias paths), reference items (such as images, CSS, JavaScripts, etc.) use the absolute path, e.g., '/assets/images' as opposed to 'assets/images'. By doing so you will prevent the browser (or web server) from appending the relative path to the alias path.
setting.use_browser:
Enable Resource Browser

Select yes to enable the resource browser. This will allow your users to browse and upload resources such as images, flash and media files on the server.
setting.use_editor:
Enable Rich Text Editor

Do you want to enable the rich text editor? If you're more comfortable writing HTML, then you can turn the editor off using this setting. Note that this setting applies to all documents and all users!
setting.use_frozen_parent_uris:
Use Frozen Parent URIs

When enabled, the URI for children resources will be relative to the frozen URI of one of its parents, ignoring the aliases of resources high in the tree.
setting.use_multibyte:
Use Multibyte Extension

Set to true if you want to use the mbstring extension for multibyte characters in your MODX installation. Only set to true if you have the mbstring PHP extension installed.
setting.use_weblink_target:
Use WebLink Target

Set to true if you want to have MODX link tags and makeUrl() generate links as the target URL for WebLinks. Otherwise, the internal MODX URL will be generated by link tags and the makeUrl() method.
setting.user_nav_parent:
User menu parent

The container used to pull all records for the user menu.
setting.webpwdreminder_message:
Web Reminder Email Enter a message to be sent to your web users whenever they request a new password via email. The Content Manager will send an email containing their new password and activation information.
Note: The following placeholders are replaced by the Content Manager when the message is sent:

[[+sname]] - Name of your web site,
[[+saddr]] - Your web site email address,
[[+surl]] - Your site URL,
[[+uid]] - User's login name or id,
[[+pwd]] - User's password,
[[+ufn]] - User's full name.

Leave the [[+uid]] and [[+pwd]] in the email, or else the username and password won't be sent in the mail and your users won't know their username or password!
setting.websignupemail_message:
Web Signup email Here you can set the message sent to your web users when you create a web account for them and let the Content Manager send them an email containing their username and password.
Note: The following placeholders are replaced by the Content Manager when the message is sent:

[[+sname]] - Name of your web site,
[[+saddr]] - Your web site email address,
[[+surl]] - Your site URL,
[[+uid]] - User's login name or id,
[[+pwd]] - User's password,
[[+ufn]] - User's full name.

Leave the [[+uid]] and [[+pwd]] in the email, or else the username and password won't be sent in the mail and your users won't know their username or password!
setting.welcome_screen:
Show Welcome Screen

If set to true, the welcome screen will show on the next successful loading of the welcome page, and then not show after that.
setting.welcome_screen_url:
Welcome Screen URL

The URL for the welcome screen that loads on first load of MODX Revolution.
setting.welcome_action:
Welcome Action

The default controller to load when accessing the manager when no controller is specified in the URL.
setting.welcome_namespace:
Welcome Namespace

The namespace the Welcome Action belongs to.
setting.which_editor:
Editor to use

Here you can select which Rich Text Editor you wish to use. You can download and install additional Rich Text Editors from Package Management.
setting.which_element_editor:
Editor to use for Elements

Here you can select which Rich Text Editor you wish to use when editing Elements. You can download and install additional Rich Text Editors from Package Management.
setting.xhtml_urls:
XHTML URLs

If set to true, all URLs generated by MODX will be XHTML-compliant, including encoding of the ampersand character.
setting.default_context:
Default Context

Select the default Context you wish to use for new Resources.
setting.auto_isfolder:
Set container automatically

If set to yes, container property will be changed automatically.
setting.default_username:
Default username

Default username for an unauthenticated user.
setting.manager_use_fullname:
Show fullname in manager header

If set to yes, the content of the "fullname" field will be shown in manager instead of "loginname"
setting.log_snippet_not_found:
Log snippets not found

If set to yes, snippets that are called but not found will be logged to the error log.
setting.error_log_filename:
Error log filename

Customize the filename of the MODX error log file (includes file extension).
setting.error_log_filepath:
Error log path

Optionally set a absolute path the a custom error log location. You might use placehodlers like {cache_path}.
context.name: Context name.
user.fullname: A full name for the User.
user.email: An email address for the User.
user.phone: A phone number for the User.
user.mobilephone: A mobile phone number for the User.
user.blocked: Whether or not this User is blocked, or prevented from logging in.
user.logincount: The total number of times this User has logged into MODX.
user.lastlogin: A UNIX timestamp showing the last time the User logged in.
user.thislogin: A UNIX timestamp showing the time this User currently logged in.
user.failedlogincount: The number of failed logins this User has accumulated.
user.sessionid: The PHP sessionid of the User.
user.dob: The date of birth of the User, in UNIX timestamp format.
user.gender: The gender of the user; 1 is male, 2 is female, 0 is unknown.
user.country: The country the User resides in.
user.state: The state, province or region for the User.
user.zip: The postal code for the User.
user.fax: A facsimile address for the User.
user.photo: Deprecated. Can still be used to store a photo location for the user.
user.extended: A JSON array of extended properties that can be used to store custom fields for the User.
var.$_modx.resource: Array with data of the current resource.
var.$_modx.user: Array with data of the current user.
var.$_modx.context: Array with data of the current context.
var.$_modx.lexicon: A `modLexicon` object that can be used to load arbitrary dictionaries.
var.$_modx.cacheManager: A `modX::cacheManager` service that allows you to set arbitrary caching times for called snippets.
var.$_modx.method.getChunk: Processes and returns the output from an HTML chunk by name.
var.$_modx.method.parseChunk: Parse a chunk using an associative array of replacement variables.
var.$_modx.method.runSnippet: Process and return the output from a PHP snippet by name.
var.$_modx.method.makeUrl: Generates a URL representing a specified resource.
var.$_modx.method.setStore: Sets any data to temporary storage.
var.$_modx.method.regClientCSS: Register CSS to be injected inside the HEAD tag of a resource.
var.$_modx.method.regClientStartupScript: Register JavaScript to be injected inside the HEAD tag of a resource.
var.$_modx.method.regClientScript: Register JavaScript to be injected before the closing BODY tag.
var.$_modx.method.regClientStartupHTMLBl: Register HTML to be injected before the closing HEAD tag.
var.$_modx.method.regClientHTMLBlock: Register HTML to be injected before the closing BODY tag.
var.$_modx.method.runProcessor: Loads and runs a specific processor. A Processor in this case is an instance of the \MODX\Revolution\Processors\Processor class that can be loaded through the provided logic described in detail below.
var.$_modx.method.hasPermission: Returns true if user has the specified policy permission.
var.$_modx.method.isAuthenticated: Determines whether this user is authorized in a particular context.
var.$_modx.method.isMember: Specifies whether the user is a member of a user group or multiple user groups. You can specify either a string user group name or an array of user group names.
var.$_modx.method.hasSessionContext: Checks whether the user has a particular session context or in other words, whether the user is "logged in" to a particular context.
var.$_modx.method.findResource: Search for a resource ID by uri.
var.$_modx.method.sendError:
Send the user to a type-specific core error page and halt PHP execution.

The parameter 'type' can be any field, which will load the template file in core/error. MODX comes prepackaged with 2 default error pages; these are 'unavailable' (the default), and 'fatal'.
var.$_modx.method.sendRedirect: Sends a redirect to the specified URL using the specified method.
var.$_modx.method.sendForward: Forwards the request to another resource without changing the URL. If the ID provided does not exist, sends to a 404 Error page.
var.$_modx.method.setPlaceholder: Sets a Placeholder value, corresponding to the "+" syntax.
var.$_modx.method.setPlaceholders: Sets a collection of placeholders stored in an array or as object vars. An optional namespace parameter can be prepended to each placeholder key in the collection, to isolate the collection of placeholders.
var.$_modx.method.toPlaceholders:
Sets placeholders from values stored in arrays and objects.

Each recursive level in the $placeholders array adds to the prefix, building an access path using an optional separator.
var.$_modx.method.toPlaceholder: Recursively validates and sets placeholders appropriate to the value type passed.
var.$_modx.method.getPlaceholder: Get a placeholder value by key.
var.$_modx.method.unsetPlaceholder: Unsets a placeholder value by key.
var.$_modx.method.unsetPlaceholders: Unset multiple placeholders, either by prefix or an array of keys.
var.$_modx.method.getChildIds: Gets all of the child resource ids for a given resource.
var.$_modx.method.getParentIds: Gets all of the parent resource ids for a given resource.
var.$_modx.method.getInfo: Gets data about the speed of the system at the moment.
var.$_modx.method.getResource: Gets an array of resource data.
var.$_modx.method.getResources: Gets an array of resources with their data.
var.$_modx.method.cleanAlias: Transforms a string to form a valid URL representation.
var.$: Unnamed system variable starts with $. and allows access to global system variables and template information.
var.$.const: returns the value of a PHP constant: `$.const.PHP_EOL` get value of constant `PHP_EOL`. Supported namespace for constants, use dot instead of back-slash for namespace separators: `$.const.Storage.FS::DIR_SEPARATOR` get value of constant `Storage\FS::DIR_SEPARATOR`. But if constant `Storage\FS::DIR_SEPARATOR` does not exists then constant `Storage\FS\DIR_SEPARATOR` will be taken..
var.$.call: call PHP static method. `$.call.Storage.FS::put($filename, $data)` calls method `Storage\FS::put($filename, $data)`.
var.$.block: check for the existence of blocks that were defined before the moment of accessing the accessor. For example: `{$.blocks.BLOCK_NAME}`.
var.$.tpl.name: returns name for current template.
var.$.tpl.basename: returns name without schema for current template.
var.$.tpl.options: returns options as integer for current template.
var.$.tpl.depends: returns an array of templates referenced by the current template.
var.$.tpl.time: returns last modified timestamp for current template.
var.foreach.index: Gets the current array index, starting with zero.
fenom.tag.set: The tag `{set}` is used for assigning template variables during the execution of a template.
fenom.tag.add: The tag `{add}` the same tag as `{set}` except that sets the value of the variable if it does not exist.
fenom.tag.var: Old name of tag `{set}`. Currently tag `{var}` the same tag as `{set}`.
fenom.tag.if: Tag `{if}` have much the same flexibility as PHP [if](http://docs.php.net/if) statements, with a few added features for the template engine. All operators, allowed functions and variables are recognized in conditions.
fenom.tag.foreach: The tag `{foreach}` construct provides an easy way to iterate over arrays and ranges.
fenom.tag.foreachelse:
`{foreachelse}` is executed when there are no values in the array variable.

`{foreachelse}` does not support tags `{break}` and `{continue}`.
fenom.tag.continue: Tag `{continue}` leaves the current iteration and begins with the next iteration.
fenom.tag.switch: The `{switch}` tag is similar to a series of `{if}` statements on the same expression. In many occasions, you may want to compare the same variable (or expression) with many different values, and execute a different piece of code depending on which value it equals to. This is exactly what the {switch} tag is for.
fenom.tag.case: The `{case}` tag is needed to describe the possible value of the expression of the parent `{switch}` tag.
fenom.tag.cycle: `{cycle}` is used to alternate a set of values.
fenom.tag.include: `{include}` tags are used for including other templates in the current template. Any variables available in the current template are also available within the included template.
fenom.tag.insert: The tag insert template code instead self. No dynamic name allowed. No variables as attribute allowed. Increase performance because insert code as is in compilation time.
fenom.tag.extends: `{extends}` tags are used in child templates in template inheritance for extending parent templates. The `{extends}` tag must be on before any block. Also if a child template extends a parent template with the `{extends}` tag it may contain only `{block}` tags. Any other template content is ignored.
fenom.tag.block: `{block}` is used to define a named area of template source for template inheritance.
fenom.tag.use: Import the blocks defined in another file. Specifying blocks in this template will override those from the other file.
fenom.tag.parent: Uses the code from the block as defined in the parent.
fenom.tag.paste: Pastes the code of any block.
fenom.tag.ignore: `{ignore}` tags allow a block of data to be taken literally. This is typically used around Javascript or stylesheet blocks where `{curly braces}` would interfere with the template delimiter syntax. Anything within `{ignore}{/ignore}` tags is not interpreted, but displayed as-is.
fenom.tag.macro: Macros are comparable with functions in regular programming languages. They are useful to put often used HTML idioms into reusable elements to not repeat yourself.
fenom.tag.import: Macros can be defined in any template, and need to be "imported" before being used. The above import call imports the "math.tpl" file (which can contain only macros, or a template and some macros), and import the functions as items of the macro namespace.
fenom.tag.autoescape: Force enable or disable auto_escape option for block area:
fenom.tag.raw: Tag `{raw <expression>}` allow outputs render results without escaping. This tag rewrite global option auto_escape for specified code.
fenom.snippet.set block: A block variant of the `{set}` tag, which allows you to set the result of rendering a template fragment as the value of a variable.
fenom.option.raw: Allows you to output the result of an expression without escaping.
fenom.option.ignore: Ignoring Fenom syntax for a block tag.
FormIt.description: FormIt is a dynamic form processing Snippet for MODX Revolution. It handles a form after submission, performing validation and followup actions like sending an email. It does not generate the form, but it can repopulate it if it fails validation.
FormIt.prop.preHooks: What scripts to fire, if any, once the form loads. This can be a comma-separated list of [hooks](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extras/formit/formit.hooks), and if the first fails, the proceeding ones will not fire. A hook can also be a Snippet name that will execute that Snippet.
FormIt.prop.renderHooks: What scripts to fire, if any, once the form loads, preHooks are finished and all fields & errors has been set.
