This can be a comma-separated list of [hooks](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extras/formit/formit.hooks) used for manipulating all the fields of the form before everything is set based on given data from other packages or preHooks. A hook can also be a Snippet name that will execute that Snippet.
FormIt.prop.hooks: What scripts to fire, if any, after the form passes validation. This can be a comma-separated list of [hooks](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extras/formit/formit.hooks), and if the first fails, the proceeding ones will not fire. A hook can also be a Snippet name that will execute that Snippet.
FormIt.prop.submitVar: If set, will not begin form processing if this POST variable is not passed. Notice: Needed if you use `&store` property (+ set submit var in input="submit"!).
FormIt.prop.validate: A comma-separated list of fields to validate, with each field name as name:validator (eg: `username:required,email:required`). Validators can also be chained, like `email:email:required`. This property can be specified on multiple lines.
FormIt.prop.validationErrorMessage: A general error message to set to a placeholder `[[!+fi.validation_error_message]]` if validation fails. Can contain `[[+errors]]` if you want to display a list of all errors at the top.
FormIt.prop.validationErrorMessage.defau: A form validation error occurred. Please check the values you have entered.
FormIt.prop.validationErrorBulkTpl: HTML tpl that is used for each individual error in the generic validation error message value.
FormIt.prop.errTpl: The wrapper html for error messages. Note: not a chunk, just straight HTML.
FormIt.prop.customValidators: A comma-separated list of custom validator names (snippets) you plan to use in this form. They must be explicitly stated here, or they will not be run.
FormIt.prop.clearFieldsOnSuccess: If true, will clear the fields on a successful form submission that does not redirect.
FormIt.prop.store: If true, will store the data in the cache for retrieval using the [FormItRetriever](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extras/formit/formit.formitretriever) snippet.
FormIt.prop.storeTime: If 'store' is set to true, this specifies the number of seconds to store the data from the form submission. Defaults to five minutes.
FormIt.prop.storeLocation: When using store, this defines where the form is stored after submit. Possible options are 'cache' and 'session'. Defaults to 'cache'.
FormIt.prop.placeholderPrefix: The prefix to use for all placeholders set by FormIt for fields. Make sure to include the '.' separator in your prefix.
FormIt.prop.successMessage: If not using the redirect hook, display this success message after a successful submission.
FormIt.prop.successMessagePlaceholder: The name of the placeholder to set the success message to.
FormIt.prop.redirectTo: page ID of a "Thank You" page, where the visitor can be sent after successfully submitting the form, but this parameter is read ONLY if you include "redirect" in the list of &hooks.
FormIt.prop.allowFiles: Specify if files are allowed to be posted. Submitted files are stored in a temporary directory to prevent files getting lost in multistep forms.
FormIt.prop.attachFilesToEmail: Attaches uploaded files in email, form needs to be set as enctype="multipart/form-data"
FormIt.prop.emailTpl: Required. Tpl chunk for email message. If one is not specified, it will send a list of fields with their values.
FormIt.prop.emailUseFieldForSubject: If 1, and the field 'subject' is passed, then will use that field's value as the email's subject line.
FormIt.prop.emailTo: A comma-separated list of emails to send to.
FormIt.prop.emailToName: Optional. A comma-separated list of names to pair with the emailTo values.
FormIt.prop.emailFrom: Optional. If set, will specify the From: address for the email. If not set, will first look for an `email` form field. If none is found, will default to the `emailsender` system setting. NOTE: Always set the `emailFrom` to a valid emailaddress (that is allowed to send from your server) to avoid rejected emails due to SPF/ DMARC violations.
FormIt.prop.emailFromName: Optional. If set, will specify the From: name for the email.
FormIt.prop.emailHtml: Optional. Whether or not the email should be in HTML-format. Defaults to 1.
FormIt.prop.emailConvertNewlines: Optional. If set to 1, will convert all newlines to br tags.
FormIt.prop.emailReplyTo: An email to set as the reply-to. If not set, will first look for an `email` form field. If none is found, will default to value set in `emailFrom`. NOTE: Set emailReplyTo to valid emailaddress from the same domain as `emailFrom` to avoid rejected email due to SPF/DMARC violations.
FormIt.prop.emailReplyToName: Optional. The name for the Reply-To field.
FormIt.prop.emailCC: A comma-separated list of emails to send via cc.
FormIt.prop.emailCCName: Optional. A comma-separated list of names to pair with the emailCC values.
FormIt.prop.emailBCC: A comma-separated list of emails to send via bcc.
FormIt.prop.emailBCCName: Optional. A comma-separated list of names to pair with the emailBCC values.
FormIt.prop.emailMultiWrapper: Wraps values submitted by checkboxes/multi-selects with this value. Defaults to just the value. (1.6.0+)
FormIt.prop.emailMultiSeparator: Separates checkboxes/multi-selects with this value. Defaults to a newline. (1.6.0+)
FormIt.prop.emailSelectField: The name of the form field, that selects the email addresses to send to. (4.2.5+)
FormIt.prop.emailSelectTo: A semicolon separated list of comma separated email addresses to send to. (4.2.5+)
FormIt.prop.emailSelectToName: A semicolon separated list of comma separated email names to send to. (4.2.5+)
FormIt.prop.fiarTpl: Required. Tpl chunk for auto-response message.
FormIt.prop.fiarToField: The name of the form field to use as the submitter's email. Defaults to "email".
FormIt.prop.fiarFrom: Optional. If set, will specify the From: address for the email. Defaults to the `emailsender` system setting.
FormIt.prop.fiarFromName: Optional. If set, will specify the From: name for the email.
FormIt.prop.fiarSender: Optional. Specify the email Sender header. Defaults to the `emailsender` system setting.
FormIt.prop.fiarHtml: Optional. Whether or not the email should be in HTML-format. Defaults to true.
FormIt.prop.fiarReplyTo: Required.An email to set as the reply-to.
FormIt.prop.fiarReplyToName: Optional. The name for the Reply-To field.
FormIt.prop.fiarCC: A comma-separated list of emails to send via cc.
FormIt.prop.fiarCCName: Optional. A comma-separated list of names to pair with the fiarCC values.
FormIt.prop.fiarBCC: A comma-separated list of emails to send via bcc.
FormIt.prop.fiarBCCName: Optional. A comma-separated list of names to pair with the fiarBCC values.
FormIt.prop.fiarMultiWrapper: Wraps values submitted by checkboxes/multi-selects with this value. Defaults to just the value.
FormIt.prop.fiarMultiSeparator:
Separates checkboxes/multi-selects with this value. Defaults to a newline. ("
")
FormIt.prop.fiarFiles: Optional. Comma separated list of files to add as attachment to the email. You cannot use a url here, only a local filesystem path.
FormIt.prop.fiarRequired: Optional. If set to false, the FormItAutoResponder hook doesn't stop when the field defined in 'fiarToField' is left empty. Defaults to true.
FormIt.prop.savedFormHashKeyField: The get parameter to take the submission hash from the url. Defaults to "savedFormHashKey".
FormIt.prop.updateSavedForm: If loading the previously submitted form values should be possible. Defaults to false.
FormIt.prop.returnValueOnFail: If the preHook should return true on fail. Defaults to true.
FormIt.prop.formName: The name of the form. Defaults to "form-{resourceid}".
FormIt.prop.formEncrypt: If is set to '1' (true) the submitted form will be encrypted before saving inside the DB.
FormIt.prop.formFields: A comma-separated list of fields that will be saved. Defaults will save all fields including the submit button.
FormIt.prop.fieldNames: Change the name of the field inside the CMP. So if the field name is email2 you could change the name to "secondary email".
FormIt.prop.fieldNames.example: fieldname==Field display name,anotherone==Another field display name
FormIt.prop.mathMinRange: The minimum range for each number in the equation.
FormIt.prop.mathMaxRange: The maximum range for each number in the equation.
FormIt.prop.mathField: The name of the input field for the answer.
FormIt.prop.mathOp1Field: The name of the field/placeholder for the 1st number in the equation.
FormIt.prop.mathOp2Field: The name of the field/placeholder for the 2nd number in the equation.
FormIt.prop.mathOperatorField: The name of the field/placeholder for the operator in the equation.
FormIt.prop.recaptchaJs: A JSON object to pass into the RecaptchaOptions var, which configures the reCaptcha widget. See the official reCaptcha docs for more information.
FormIt.prop.redirectParams: A JSON object of parameters to pass in the redirect URL.
FormIt.prop.spamEmailFields: Optional. A comma-delimited list of email fields to check. Defaults to 'email'.
FormIt.prop.spamCheckIp: If true, will also check the IP of the submitter. Defaults to false.
FormItRetriever.description: FormItRetriever is an assistance snippet for [FormIt](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extras/formit) that will grab the data of a user's last form submission via FormIt. This is useful for "Thank You" pages where a user is sent after submitting a form.
FormItRetriever.prop.placeholderPrefix: A string to prefix all placeholders for form fields that will be set by this Snippet.
FormItRetriever.prop.redirectToOnNotFoun: If the data is not found and if this is set, redirect to the Resource with this ID.
FormItRetriever.prop.eraseOnLoad: If true, will erase the stored form data on load. Strongly recommended to leave to false unless you only want the data to load once.
FormItRetriever.prop.storeLocation: Where to get the form data from. Should be equal to the storeLocation property of your FormIt snippet call. Possible values are 'cache' and 'session'. Defaults to 'cache'.
FormItStateOptions.description: FormItStateOptions is an assistance snippet for [FormIt](https://docs.modx.com/current/en/extras/formit) 1.7.0+ that will output an option list of U.S. states. It is useful for forms that need a dropdown list of U.S. states.
FormItStateOptions.prop.selectedAttribut: Optional. The HTML attribute to add to a selected country.
FormItStateOptions.prop.tpl: Optional. The chunk to use for each country dropdown option.
FormItStateOptions.prop.useAbbr: If 1, will use the state abbreviation for the value. If 0, will use the full state name.
FormItStateOptions.prop.toPlaceholder: Optional. Use this to set the output to a placeholder instead of outputting directly.
FetchIt.description: An lightweight Extra for processing forms using the Fetch API.
FetchIt.prop.form: Chunk with the form to be processed.
FetchIt.prop.snippet: Name of callable snippet for form processing.
FetchIt.prop.actionUrl: The address of the connector to which the form is sent.
FetchIt.prop.clearFieldsOnSuccess: If true, will clear the fields on a successful form submission.
pdoTools.prop.parents: List of parents to search the result, separated by commas. If you put 0, the sample is not limited. If parent id begins with a hyphen, it and its children are eliminated from the sample. If you have to limit the sample by `&depth` parameter in resource root, you should use ``&parents=`0` ``
pdoTools.prop.depth: Search depth of child resources from its parent.
pdoTools.prop.resources: List of resources to search the results, separated by commas. If resource id begins with a hyphen, this resource is eliminated from the sample.
pdoTools.prop.templates: List of templates to filter the results, separated by commas. If template id begins with a hyphen, resources with it are eliminated from the sample.
pdoTools.prop.context: Sample limitation by the resource context.
pdoTools.prop.where: Extra parameter array of the sample coded in JSON.
pdoTools.prop.hideContainers: Exclude container resources, that is, resources with isfolder = 1.
pdoTools.prop.hideUnsearchable: Exclude the resources hidden from the search.
pdoTools.prop.select: List of fields for sample, separated by commas. JSON can be indicated with the array, e.g. `{"modResource":"id,pagetitle,content"}`.
pdoTools.prop.sortby: Any resource field for sorting, it includes TV parameter, if it is indicated in &includeTVs parameter. JSON line can be indicated with array for several fields. Indicate RAND() for random sorting
pdoTools.prop.groupby: Indicate the field by which results are grouped.
pdoTools.prop.having: It is used to limit the sample of grouping lines by condition for the whole group, specified in **&groupby**.
pdoTools.prop.limit: Limitation of sample results. 0 can be used.
pdoTools.prop.first: Number of the first iteration in output results.
pdoTools.prop.last: Number of the last iteration in output results.
pdoTools.prop.loadModels: List of components, which models should be downloaded for query building, they should be separated by commas, e.g. ``&loadModels=`ms2gallery,msearch2` ``.
pdoTools.prop.tvFilters: List of TV filters with delimiter AND and OR. Delimiter, indicated in **&tvFiltersOrDelimiter** is a logic condition OR and its conditions are grouped in the first place. You can define the list of values in each group, separated by **&tvFiltersAndDelimiter**. Search of values can be held in any specific TV, if it is (`myTV==value`) or any (`value`). E.g. ``&tvFilters=`filter2==one,filter1==bar%||filter1==foo` ``. Pay attention: filtration uses LIKE and % is metacharacter. Search is on values that physically located in the database, i.e. values from TV settings dont get here on default
pdoTools.prop.sortbyTV: Additional field by which all the results should be sorted. It can be indicated directly in **&sortby**.
pdoTools.prop.sortdirTV: Sorting direction on extra fiend indicated in **&sortby**. It can be indicated directly in **&sortby**.
pdoTools.prop.sortbyTVType: Type of sorting by TV parameter. Possible options: **string**, **integer**, **decimal** and **datetime**. If empty, the TV will be sorted according to its type: as text, number or date.
pdoTools.prop.checkPermissions: Indicate which permissions should be checked at the output of objects.
pdoTools.prop.disableConditions: It disables specific class modResource sample parameters.
pdoTools.prop.fenomModifiers: Comma separated list of snippets that could be used as [fenom modifier](https://docs.modx.pro/components/pdotools/parser).
pdoTools.prop.tpl: Chunk name for resource registration. If it not indicated, field content of the source will be printed to the screen.
pdoTools.prop.tplFirst: Chunk name for the first resource in the results.
pdoTools.prop.tplLast: Chunk name for the last resource in the results.
pdoTools.prop.tplOdd: Chunk name for every second resource.
pdoTools.prop.tpl_N: Chunk name for N-resource, e.g. ``&tpl_4=`tpl4th` `` will set up template for 4th resource.
pdoTools.prop.tpl_nN: Chunk name for N-resource, e.g. ``&tpl_n4=`tplEvery4th` `` will be applied for every 4th resource.
pdoTools.prop.tplCondition: Resource field from which the value for selecting chunk will be obtained by the condition in **&conditionalTpls**.
pdoTools.prop.tplOperator: Optional operator for comparison of resource field in **&tplCondition** with array of values and chunks in **&conditionalTpls**.
pdoTools.prop.conditionalTpls: JSON line with array which in keys has something which **&tplCondition** will be compared with, and values  chunks which will be used to output if the comparison is successful. Comparison operator is indicated in **&tplOperator**. Arrays without keys can be used for `isempty` operators.
pdoTools.prop.outputSeparator: Optional line for separation of the results.
pdoTools.prop.return: It defines the way of result output. Chunks  gauging, data  output value fields, sql  output of SQL-demand, ids  symbols separated by commas.
pdoTools.prop.fastMode: Fast more of chunk processing. All raw tags (conditions, snippets and so on) will be cut.
pdoTools.prop.nestedChunkPrefix: Prefix for fast placeholders, included by **&fastMode** parameter.
pdoTools.prop.idx: You can indicate the initial number of iteration for result output.
pdoTools.prop.totalVar: Name of placeholders for saving the total number of results.
pdoTools.prop.includeContent: Include the field content to the output.
pdoTools.prop.includeTVs: List of TV parameters for the output, separated by commas. E.g.: `action,time` will yield placeholders `[[+action]]` and `[[+time]]`.
pdoTools.prop.prepareTVs: List of TV parameters that need to be processed before the output.
pdoTools.prop.processTVs: List of TV parameters that need to be processed before the output. If it is set in 1, all TV mentioned in **&includeTVs** will be processed.
pdoTools.prop.prepareSnippet: Indicate the snippet that accepts data before the output in chunk and can vary or add them.
pdoTools.prop.decodeJSON: Indicate the snippet that accepts data before the output in chunk and can vary or add them.
pdoTools.prop.scheme: Scheme of forming url is passed to `modX::makeUrl()`.
pdoTools.prop.useWeblinkUrl: Ensure the link subject to resource class.
pdoTools.prop.toSeparatePlaceholders: If you indicate a word in this parameter, ALL the results will be specified in different placeholders that begin with this word and end with the serial number of the line from zero. E.g. indicating myPl, you get placeholders `[[+myPl0]]`, `[[+myPl1]]` and so on
pdoTools.prop.cache_key.default: Value of system setting cache_resource_key for resources (on default resource) or default
pdoTools.prop.cache_handler.default: Value of system setting cache_resource_handler or xPDOFileCache
pdoTools.prop.cacheTime.default: Value of system setting cache_resource_expires or 0 (eternal)
pdoArchive.description: The snippet is designed to display the site's document archive broken down by years, months, and days.
pdoArchive.prop.tpl: Name of a chunk serving as a resource template. If not provided, properties are dumped to output for each resource.
pdoArchive.prop.tplWrapper: Chunk for formatting the wrapper, to wrap all results. Provides one placeholder: `[[+output]]`. It does not work in conjunction with **&toSeparatePlaceholders**.
pdoArchive.prop.wrapIfEmpty: Output the chunk wrapper **&tplWrapper** even if there are no results.
pdoArchive.prop.dateField: The field of resource for obtaining document date: createdon, publishedon, or editedon.
pdoArchive.prop.dateFormat: The date format for the function strftime().
pdoArchive.prop.showLog: If true, snippet will add detailed log of query for developers.
pdoArchive.prop.sortby: Any resource field for sorting, including TV option the property **&includeTVs** is set. A JSON string can be specified with an array of several fields, for example ``&sortby=`{"tvname":"ASC","pagetitle":"DESC"}` ``. To randomly select sorting use ``&sortby=`RAND()` ``.
pdoArchive.prop.sortdir: Sort Direction: Ascending or Descending. If parameters &sortby and &sortdir will be empty the sorting will be in the order of resources in &resources parameter.
pdoArchive.prop.limit: Limits the number of resources returned.  Use "0" for unlimited results.
pdoArchive.prop.outputSeparator: The character to use as a separator between the crumbs.
pdoArchive.prop.toPlaceholder: If not empty, the snippet will save all data to a placeholder with the same name , instead of displaying the output to the screen.
pdoArchive.prop.showHidden: Show resources that are hidden in the menu.
pdoCrumbs.prop.from: Id of the resource from which to begin to build the breadcrumbs . This is usually the root of the site, which is "0".
pdoCrumbs.prop.to: Id of the resource with which end the breadcrumbs . By default, the id of the current page.
pdoCrumbs.prop.exclude: Comma-separated list of resource IDs that should be excluded from the output.
pdoCrumbs.prop.toPlaceholder: If not empty, the snippet will save all data to a placeholder with the same name , instead of displaying the output to the screen.
pdoCrumbs.prop.outputSeparator: The character to use as a separator between the crumbs.
pdoCrumbs.prop.tpl: Name of chunk for formatting the output. If not specified, the contents of the resource fields will be printed to the screen.
pdoCrumbs.prop.tplCurrent: Chunk for formatting the current resource's crumb in the navigation.
pdoCrumbs.prop.tplMax: Chunk which is added to the end of the results, if there are more than **&limit** crumbs.
pdoCrumbs.prop.tplHome: Chunk for formatting the link on the home page.
pdoCrumbs.prop.tplWrapper: Chunk for formatting the wrapper, to wrap all results. Provides one placeholder: `[[+output]]`. It does not work in conjunction with **&toSeparatePlaceholders**.
pdoCrumbs.prop.wrapIfEmpty: Output the chunk wrapper **&tplWrapper** even if there are no results.
pdoCrumbs.prop.showCurrent: Display the current document in the navigation.
pdoCrumbs.prop.showHome: Display a crumb for the home page.
pdoCrumbs.prop.showAtHome: Show breadcrumbs on the home page.
pdoCrumbs.prop.hideSingle: Do not display the result if it is only a single crumb.
pdoCrumbs.prop.direction: The direction of navigation: from left to right ltr or right to left rtl, such as for Arabic.
pdoCrumbs.prop.showLog: Show additional information on the work of the snippet . Only displayed to users logged in to the mgr context.
pdoField.description: This snippet has the functionality of both [getResourceField](http://rtfm.modx.com/extras/revo/getresourcefield) and [UltimateParent](http://modx.com/extras/package/ultimateparent), that is, it displays any field from the specified resource or of its parent, including TV values.
pdoField.prop.top: Selects the root-level parent of the specified resource.
pdoField.prop.topLevel: Selects the resource's parent at this level from the root level.
pdoField.prop.default: Specifies the resource field to return if **&field** is empty. Faster than the Output Modifier filter :default =
pdoField.prop.output: It specifies the string that is returned if **&default** and **&field** are all empty .
pdoField.prop.toPlaceholder: If not empty, the snippet will save the field value to a placeholder with the same name, instead of displaying it to the screen.
pdoMenu.description: Menu generator snippet. It can replace Wayfinder, and allows more flexibility to specify properties.
pdoMenu.prop.level: The level (depth) of the generated menu.
pdoMenu.prop.displayStart: Include display of parent node. It is useful when you specify more than one parents.
pdoMenu.prop.previewUnpublished: Show unpublished resources only for logged-in Manager users with permission to view unpublished.
pdoMenu.prop.sortby: Any resource field for sorting, including TV option the property **&includeTVs** is set. A JSON string can be specified with an array of several fields, for example ``&sortby=`{"tvname":"ASC","pagetitle":"DESC"}` ``. To randomly select sorting use ``&sortby=`RAND()` ``.
pdoMenu.prop.sortdir: Sort Direction: Ascending or Descending. If parameters &sortby and &sortdir will be empty the sorting will be in the order of resources in &resources parameter.
pdoMenu.prop.offset: Results skip from the beginning. It should be used with **&limit**.
pdoMenu.prop.countChildren: Count of the number of children of each parent resource and output it to the placeholder `[[+children]]`. It makes additional queries to the database, so is 0 by default.
pdoMenu.prop.plPrefix: Prefix for placeholders used in the template chunks.
pdoMenu.prop.showLog: Show debugging details on the processing of the snippet. Only displayed to logged-in Manager users.
pdoMenu.prop.rowIdPrefix: If set, this parameter creates a unique ID for each item. The value will be rowIdPrefix + docId.
pdoMenu.prop.hereId: Define the current ID to use for the snippet. Use a value of `[[*id]]` if the template specified by **&tplHere** and **&tplParentRowActive** is not applied correctly to the menu item.
pdoMenu.prop.tplOuter: Chunk to wrap the entire menu block.
pdoMenu.prop.tpl: Chunk for processing each resource. If not specified, the contents of the resource fields will be printed to the screen.
pdoMenu.prop.tplStart: Chunk for the parent resource, provided that **&displayStart** is also used.
pdoMenu.prop.tplParentRow: Chunk for container item with children.
pdoMenu.prop.tplCategoryFolder: Special chunk for category resources. Category resources have isfolder = 1, and (empty) template or attribute rel = category. Useful for creating top-level menu items that are not themselves active links.
pdoMenu.prop.tplInner: Chunk wrapper for submenu sections. If empty will use **&tplOuter**.
pdoMenu.prop.firstClass: Class for the first menu item.
pdoMenu.prop.lastClass: Class for the last menu item.
pdoMenu.prop.hereClass: Class for the active menu item and its parents.
pdoMenu.prop.levelClass: Class for each level of the menu. For example, if you specify level, it will produce level1, level2 etc.
pdoMenu.prop.selfClass: Class for the current document in the menu.
pdoNeighbors.description: The snippet pdoNeighbors displays the previous and the next resources.
pdoNeighbors.prop.id: The resource ID, of which are displayed the neighbors.
pdoNeighbors.prop.loop: Hide/show neighbours first/last entry if at the end of list.
pdoNeighbors.prop.tplPrev: Chunk reference to the previous document.
pdoNeighbors.prop.tplUp: Chunk reference to the parent document.
pdoNeighbors.prop.tplNext: Chunk reference to the following document.
pdoNeighbors.prop.tplWrapper: Chunk-wrapper for wrapping results. Uses placeholders: `[[+left]]`, `[[+top]]`, `[[+right]]` AND `[[+log]]`. It does not work in conjunction with **&toSeparatePlaceholders**.
pdoNeighbors.prop.toPlaceholder: If not empty, the snippet will save all data to the placeholder specified, instead of displaying the output with the snippet call.
pdoNeighbors.prop.showLog: Display log information of the snippet. Only authorized in the context mgr.
pdoPage.description: Snippet pdoPage allows you to view the work of other snippets with the pagination.
pdoPage.prop.limit: Limits the number of resources returned. Use `0` for unlimited results.
pdoPage.prop.maxLimit: The maximum limit of the query. Overrides the limit specified by the user via a url.
pdoPage.prop.page: Number of page for output. Overlaps number specified by the user via the url.
pdoPage.prop.pageVarKey: The Name of the variable to search for the page number in the url.
pdoPage.prop.totalVar: Define the key of a placeholder set by getResources indicating the total number of Resources that would be selected not considering the limit value.
pdoPage.prop.pageLimit: Number of links on a pages. If is 7 or more turns on the advanced mode.
pdoPage.prop.element: The name of the snippet to run.
pdoPage.prop.pageNavVar: Name of placeholder for output pagination.
pdoPage.prop.pageCountVar: Name of placeholder for output number of pages.
pdoPage.prop.pageLinkScheme: Scheme of generation link to page. You can use placeholders `[[+pageVarKey]]` and `[[+page]]`
pdoPage.prop.cache: Caching the results of the snippet.
pdoPage.prop.cache_user: Forcibly sets the visitor ID, by default caching is done with the visitor ID in mind.
pdoPage.prop.toPlaceholder: If set, will assign the result to this placeholder instead of outputting it directly.
pdoPage.prop.ajaxMode: Ajax pagination out of the box. Available in 3 modes: `default`, `button` and `scroll`.
pdoPage.prop.ajaxElemWrapper: jQuery selector for wrapper element with the results and pagination.
pdoPage.prop.ajaxElemRows: jQuery selector for element with results.
pdoPage.prop.ajaxElemPagination: jQuery selector for element with pagination.
pdoPage.prop.ajaxElemMore: jQuery selector for "load more" button in ajaxMode = button.
pdoPage.prop.ajaxHistory: Save the page number in the url when working in ajax mode.
pdoPage.prop.frontend_js: Link on javascript for loading by the snippet.
pdoPage.prop.frontend_css: Link on css styles for loading by the snippet.
pdoPage.prop.setMeta: Registration of meta tags with links to previous and next page.
pdoPage.prop.strictMode: Strict mode. pdoPage do redirects when loading non-existent pages.
pdoPage.prop.ajaxTplMore: Chunk for templating "more button" when ajaxMode = button. Must include a selector specified in "ajaxElemMore".
pdoPage.prop.tplPage: Chunk of registration of the normal link to the page.
pdoPage.prop.tplPageWrapper: Chunk of the decoration of the block pagination, as you could see placeholders contains pages.
pdoPage.prop.tplPageActive: Chunk of the link to the current page.
pdoPage.prop.tplPageFirst: Chunk of the link to the first page.
pdoPage.prop.tplPageLast: Chunk of the link to the last page.
pdoPage.prop.tplPagePrev: Chunk of the link to the previous page.
pdoPage.prop.tplPageNext: Chunk of the link to the next page.
pdoPage.prop.tplPageSkip: Chunk clearance missing pages in advanced mode, the display (**&pageLimit** >= 7).
pdoPage.prop.tplPageFirstEmpty: Chunk output if no link to the first page.
pdoPage.prop.tplPageLastEmpty: Chunk output if no link to the last page.
pdoPage.prop.tplPagePrevEmpty: Chunk output if no link to the previous page.
pdoPage.prop.tplPageNextEmpty: Chunk output if no link to the next page.
pdoResources.description: Snippet to display a list of resources. It is an advanced replacement for getResources: it has all the features but without flaws.
pdoResources.prop.showHidden: Show resources that are hidden in the menu.
pdoResources.prop.setTotal: Indicates if the total placeholder should be populated with a count of the results.
pdoResources.prop.limit: Limit the number of results . You can use 0 for no limit.
pdoResources.prop.offset: Number of items to skip, from the beginning
pdoResources.prop.returnIds: Set to "1" to return a string with a list of resource ids, instead of complete results. All of the templates are ignored.
pdoResources.prop.tplWrapper: Chunk - wrapper, to wrap all results. Accepts one placeholder: `[[+output]]`. It does not work in conjunction with **&toSeparatePlaceholders**.
pdoResources.prop.wrapIfEmpty: Includes outer chunk wrapper **&tplWrapper** even if there are no results.
pdoResources.prop.totalVar: Name of the placeholder for storing the total number of results.
pdoResources.prop.toPlaceholder: Save output to a placeholder with this name instead of displaying the output to the screen.
pdoResources.prop.showLog: Show additional debugging information on the processing of the snippet only to logged-in Manager users.
pdoSitemap.description: pdoSitemap i a snippet that easily creates sitemaps for search engines (sitemap.xml). The snippet understands the parameters used by the snippet [GoogleSitemap](http://rtfm.modx.com/extras/revo/googlesitemap) (by translation to the native parameters) and can therefore easily replace it.
pdoSitemap.prop.sitemapSchema: The scheme used for the sitemap.
pdoSitemap.prop.priorityTV: An optional field that indicates the [](http://www.sitemaps.org/ru/protocol.html#prioritydef) of the resource. The template variable stated here must also be added to the parameter **&includeTVs**.
pdoTitle.description: The snippet outputs a formatted title tag to a page on the site, which consists of the name of the page, the names of the parents of that page and, other parameters.
pdoTitle.prop.limit: The limit of a query for parents of the resource.
pdoTitle.prop.titleField: Field of the current resource to be displayed in the page title.
pdoTitle.prop.cache: Enable cache of resource parents for the page title.
pdoTitle.prop.cacheTime: Time until the cache expires, in seconds.
pdoTitle.prop.tplPages: Template of pagination in the page title.
pdoTitle.prop.pageVarKey: The Name of the variable to search for the page number in the url.
pdoTitle.prop.tplSearch: Template of search query in the page title.
pdoTitle.prop.queryVarKey: The name of variable for the search query in the url.
pdoTitle.prop.minQuery: The minimum length of the search query to be displayed in the page title.
pdoTitle.prop.outputSeparator: String to separate elements in the page title.
pdoTitle.prop.registerJs: Insert to page the javascript variables for support **&ajaxMode** of snippet pdoPage.
pdoUsers.description: Snippet to list the site users, based on the pdoTools library.
pdoUsers.prop.groups: List of user groups, separated by commas. You can use the names and id. If the value begins with dash it means users belonging to this group will be skipped.
pdoUsers.prop.roles: List of user roles, separated by commas. You can use the names and id. If the value begins with a dash, then users with this role will be skipped.
pdoUsers.prop.users: List for output, separated by commas. You can use usernames and id. If the value begins with a dash, that user will be excluded from the results.
pdoUsers.prop.showInactive: Includes Inactive users in the results.
pdoUsers.prop.showBlocked: Includes Blocked users in the results.
pdoUsers.prop.returnIds: Returns a string with a list of user ids instead of formatted results.
pdoUsers.prop.showLog: Show more information about running the snippet. Only displayed for logged-in users with the mgr context authorization.
pdoUsers.prop.toPlaceholder: If not empty, this will the save output to a placeholder with this name instead of displaying the output to the screen.
pdoUsers.prop.wrapIfEmpty: Includes output chunk wrapper **&tplWrapper** even if there are no results.
pdoUsers.prop.tplWrapper: Chunk - wrapper, to wrap all results. Accepts one placeholder: `[[+output]]`. It does not work in conjunction with **&toSeparatePlaceholders**.
pdoUsers.prop.class: The base User class for MODX Revolution.
pdoUsers.prop.sortby: Any user field for sorting. You can specify a JSON string with an array of multiple fields. To randomly select the sort `RAND()`.
msProducts.prop.depth: Depth of searching goods of every parent.
msProducts.prop.sortby: Sample sorting. To sort by item fields the prefix "Data" should be added, for example: ``&sortby=`Data.price` ``
msProducts.prop.sortbyOptions: Indicates how and by what options to sort among listed in **&sortby**. Passed by a line, for example, "optionkey:integer,optionkey2:datetime"
msProducts.prop.includeThumbs: The list of sample preview dimensions separated by commas. For example: `120x90,360x240` are given by placeholders `[[+120x90]]` and `[[+360x240]]`. The pictures should be pre-generated in item gallery.
msProducts.prop.optionFilters: Goods option filters. Transmitted by JSON line.
msProducts.prop.link: Goods link Id, which is automatically assigned in settings when new link is created.
msProducts.prop.master: Master item Id. If both "master" and "slave" are indicated the sampling will follow master.
msProducts.prop.slave: Id of affiliated item. If "master" is set this option will be ignored.
msProducts.prop.returnIds: To return goods id line, instead of formatted chunks.
msProducts.prop.showZeroPrice: To display goods with zero price.
msCart.description: Snippet is designed to display customer's cart.
msCart.prop.includeThumbs: The list of sample preview dimensions separated by commas. For example: `120x90,360x240` are given by placeholders `[[+120x90]]` and `[[+360x240]]`. The pictures should be pre-generated in item gallery.
msOrder.prop.userFields: Associative array of matching order fields to user profile fields in the format "order field" => "profile field".
msMiniCart.description: The simple snippet for cart current status display.
msGetOrder.description:
Snippet for formed order display.

Is used on ordering page and for mailing notification to customers.
msGetOrder.prop.includeThumbs: The list of sample preview dimensions separated by commas. For example: `120x90,360x240` are given by placeholders `[[+120x90]]` and `[[+360x240]]`. The pictures should be pre-generated in item gallery.
msGallery.prop.product: Product identifier. If not indicated, current document id is used.
msGallery.prop.filetype: File type for sampling. "image" may be used for picture indication and other files extension.
msOptions.description: Snippet for additional product characteristics display, stored as JSON.
msOptions.prop.product: Product identifier. If not indicated, the current document id is used.
msOptions.prop.options: List of option for displaying, separated by commas.
msProductOptions.description: This snippet simply displays the list of additional product options without choice unlike msOptions.
msProductOptions.prop.product: Product identifier. If not indicated, id of the current document is used.
msProductOptions.prop.onlyOptions: Display only this option list, separated by commas.
msProductOptions.prop.ignoreOptions: The options, which do not need to be listed, separated by commas.
msProductOptions.prop.groups: To display only indicated group options (category name or identifier, separated by commas).
